displaytitle: La Soeur de Duguesclin, illustration for the Chroniques de France by Mademoiselle Amable Tastu
markings:
Collector Gustave Morin's stamp, lower center: (Lugt 1178)

Inscribed in graphite, lower left corner: 1137

Inscribed in graphite along edge, lower center: Original lithograph date 1829
inscribed:
Printed above stone, left and right: Chroniques de France / Chateau de Pontorson

Printed below stone, left to right: Delacroix fect. / Imp lith de H. Gaugain

Captioned beneath stone, center: Soudain courant à lui, la soeur du Chatelain / Le frappe de l’epée s’ecriant: Guesclin! / Octobre 1829

Printed, lower left and right: A Paris chez H. Gaugain & Compe / Rue Vivienne No 2 et rue de vaugirard No 34 / London by Engelman Graff, Coindet & Co / Dean Street, Soho.

titles.title: La Soeur de Duguesclin (The Sisters of Duguesclin)

makers.displaydate: 1798–1863; born Clarenton-Saint Maurice, France; died Paris, France

displaymaker: Eugène Delacroix, 1798–1863; born Clarenton-Saint Maurice, France; died Paris, France | Printed and published by Henri Gaugain, French, 1799–after 1834 | Published by Godefroy Engelmann, French, 1788–1839
caption: Eugène Delacroix (1798–1863; born Clarenton-Saint Maurice, France; died Paris, France), Printed and published by Henri Gaugain (French, 1799–after 1834), Published by Godefroy Engelmann (French, 1788–1839), La Soeur de Duguesclin, illustration for the Chroniques de France by Mademoiselle Amable Tastu, 1829. Lithograph; 25 x 20.1 cm (image), 32 x 24 cm (sheet). Laura P. Hall Memorial Collection (x1946-201)
